title: RuPaul Scores Glamorous Chateau in Beverly Hills
text:
RuPaul has purchased a neoclassical chateau in Beverly Hills for $13.7 million, an appropriately glamorous home for the world’s most famous drag queen.



Its imposing columned entryway looms from its hillside perch over Laurel Way and a set of showy front steps. A trust for RuPaul Charles, creator and producer of reality-TV hit “RuPaul’s Drag Race,” closed on the new digs in late September, property records show.



More: Paul Allen’s Beverly Hills Development Site Lists for $110 Million

Completed in 1991, the palatial six-bedroom house spans over 10,300 square feet and sits on roughly half an acre by celebrity-favored Coldwater Canyon, according to the listing with Myra and Michael Nourmand of Nourmand & Associates-Berkshire Hathaway. The agents did not immediately return a request for comment.



The cavernous interiors feature double-height ceilings across much of the first floor, including a dramatic marble-tiled entryway. Same goes for the voluminous dining room, which is flooded with light from a trifecta of soaring glass French doors.



Elaborate molding, fireplaces and intricately patterned French parquet floors add to the home’s regal European vibe.



There are also all of the add-ons one comes to expect from a Beverly Hills megamansion, including a wine cellar, home gym and media room. The private back terrace—lined in tall hedges—features a regency-style pool with a spa and elegant gazebo.

Mr. Charles, who could not be reached for comment, cut a deal on his new abode, coming in after the home received numerous price cuts. It originally listed a year ago asking a hair below $20 million.



A major upgrade for the star, the luxurious home underscores the success of the entertainer’s self-titled TV series, which just expanded its drag competitions across the pond with a U.K. launch this week. The new home is more than triple the size of a modest house he’s owned in West Hollywood since 2011, property records show.
